info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 11:39AM CDT until July 5 at 4:47AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River At Comfort affecting Kendall County.
Guadalupe River At Kerrville affecting Kerr County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Guadalupe River at Kerrville.
* WHEN...Until late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flow reaches the first floor of a resort and restaurant upstream left bank. Near the USGS 1:10 year flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Friday was 36.58 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage with a maximum value of 16.7 feet through this afternoon. It will then fall below the flood stage of 9.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight by 500 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TONIGHT
